subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: A check for detecting XML nodes that match a supplied XPath expression. Works inly with XML files.
Rationale: This check can be used to prototype checks and to find common bad practice such as putting too many child at the same node level, writing nodes with too many attributes, etc.

tr.td: message which is used to notify about violations, if empty then default(hard-coded) message is used.
The minimum number of matches required in each file.
The maximum number of matches required in each file.
file type extension of files to process

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check so that it accepts file with less than 1500 child for a node:
subsection.source: <module name="XPathCheck"> <property name="expression" value="//*[count(*)>=100]"/> <!-- next line not required as 0 is the default --> <property name="min" value="0"/> <property name="max" value="1500"/> </module>

subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: A check for detecting XML nodes that match a supplied XQuery expression. Works inly with XML files.
Business This check can be used to prototype checks and to find forbidden complicated practice such as make a attribute value matching another, etc.

tr.td: message which is used to notify about violations, if empty then default(hard-coded) message is used.
The minimum number of matches required in each file.
The maximum number of matches required in each file.
file type extension of files to process

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check so that it reject files not matching a business rule:
subsection.source: <module name="XQueryCheck"> <property name="expression" value=" for $x in //parent_element, $name in $x/name/@value, $child1 in $x/child1/@value, $child2 in $x/child2/@value where $child1 != $name and $port != $name return $x " /> <!-- next line not required as 0 is the default --> <property name="min" value="0"/> <property name="max" value="0"/> </module>
